name: Lumia
blurb: I provided guidance and supervision on set, working closley with DP to frame shots in anticipation of added MoGraph elements. Then I worked with the Lumia team to develop and animate UI elements to simply illustrate primary functions of the Lumia 2. Helped with minor touch-ups and enhancements to footage as well.

name: Field Reports
subtitle: Nike
blurb: I was resposible for building a CG grass system and comp work for the central shot in the "Breathe" peice of the campaign.

name: Qi Health
blurb: I worked directly with Jangho and the Qi team to come up with a visual style that effectivley communicated the feel and functionality of the Qi Health app. I also coordinated with Atlantic Pictures to establish a team of freelancers to get the work done in just a few weeks.

name: Dolphin x Jets Rivals

blurb: I was responsible for invisible VFX, changing and removing names and logos to keep the Instagram teaser for the Nike Dolphins x Jets Rivalry jerseys as focused as possible.

name: Trackstar* Bumper
credits: Studio, Public Opinion[https://www.publicopinion.nyc/];
blurb: I created an animated openeing sequence for Public Opinion Production's Trackstar Podcast. The task was open ended, with media assets to be included and a mixed media aesthetic similar to that which I had established in my other work for Public Opinion.

name: A Different League
subtitle: Big XII
blurb: I helped with two set extensions on this project, bulding out new football fields using 2D assets and procedural noise.

name: Postcards of Summer
subtitle: 90 Plus Cellars
blurb: To show 3 different looks and 3 different bottles in a single, locked-off zoom shot. Harkening back to the Corona commercials of the 90’s, this “oner” is 7 different shots seamlessley stiched together. Provided guidence on set and responsible for all splitscreen comp work as well as minor touch-ups and paintouts.

name: The Subway
subtitle: Chappell Roan
blurb: I represented Corduroy VFX on set, working closely with the lead creative team and coordinating VFX-heavy sequences. I worked with G&E, stunts, and art department to build bluescreen sets, modify props, and help talent feel comfortable. I also gathered HDRI, LiDAR, refrence photography, and other measurments to set team up for success.

name: Cincinnati Insurance
credits:
Studio,Corduroy[https://corduroy.studio/];
Client, Cincinnati Financial;
blurb: I created an eye-catching opening shot for a home insurance television commerical. I was also responsible for building a CG destruction scene, compositing into plate photography and comping minor touch-ups and paint-outs.

name: Under the Lights
blurb: I created a CG brain shot using geometry generated in Houdini, rendered in Blender, and comped in Nuke.

name: 360 Camera Tracking
subtitle: Insta360
credits:
Client, Insta360;
Creator, MAKE. ART. NOW.;
blurb: An experiment where I came up with a method of resolving camera movement through the use of a synced, Insta360 X4 360° witness camera. I used Syntheyes to track and solve the shot, and line the two cameras up in virtual space in Blender. Insta360 press release[https://www.insta360.com/blog/creator-stories/insta360-vfx-reality-capture.html]
